x*h = h*x

Order doesn't matter. Can flip either signal in graphical convolution.

(x*h₁)*h₂ = x*(h₁*h₂)

Can pre-compute cascade impulse responses, then convolve once with input.

x*(h₁+h₂) = x*h₁ + x*h₂

Represents parallel systems. Analyze paths separately, add outputs.

x(t)*δ(t-T) = x(t-T)

Shifted impulse delays the signal. Essential for understanding time delays.

d/dt[x*h] = (dx/dt)*h = x*(dh/dt)

Can differentiate either signal. Choose whichever is easier.

(Kx)*h = K(x*h) = x*(Kh)

Convolution is linear. Scaling input or impulse response scales output.
If h₁*h₂ = δ, then h₂ is inverse of h₁. Cascading them gives identity. Used for equalization.

width(x*h) = width(x) + width(h)

Durations add in convolution. Output is wider than either input.

Triangle function

Self-convolution of rectangle gives triangular pulse. Overlap increases then decreases.

x(at)*h(at) = (1/|a|)y(at)

Scaling both signals scales result with 1/|a| factor.
